channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: BiggerPockets Hosts Powerhouse Real Estate Investors Conference With BPCON2024
item.description: BPCON2024 will be held from Oct. 6-8 in Cancun, Mexico.

item.title: SpaceX sent Starship to orbit — the next launch will try to bring it back
item.description: SpaceX’s massive Starship rocket could take to the skies for the fourth time on June 5, with the primary objective of evaluating the second stage’s reusable heat shield as the vehicle tries to safely reenter the atmosphere for the first time. CEO Elon Musk“ said on his social media platform X that “There are many […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: A Legal Doctrine That Shields Police From Many Lawsuits May Be Losing Support
item.description: A federal judge in Mississippi joined other courts in recently rejecting police arguments that qualified immunity protected their actions.

item.title: Federal Experts Talk Bird Flu ‘What Ifs’ in WebMD Live Event
item.description: WebMD brought together experts from four federal agencies to talk prevention, monitoring, and what the “what ifs” of bird flu might look like.

item.title: Data-Backed Solutions: Addressing the Top Real Estate Challenges of 2024
item.description: This article is presented by PropStream. Read our editorial guidelines for more information. The housing market is an increasingly challenging place for investors right now. The costs of investing in real estate […]

item.title: Billionaire Groupon founder Eric Lefkofsky is back with another IPO: AI health tech Tempus
item.description: Eric Lefkofsky knows the public listing rodeo well and is about to enter it for a fourth time. The serial entrepreneur, whose net worth is estimated at nearly $4 billion, has already taken three businesses he’s founded public. Today he’s the founder of Tempus, a genomic testing and data analysis company preparing to IPO. But […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Out of the Blue: The Rise and Fall of a Black Cop
item.description: After Cleveland officer Vincent Montague shot a Black man, he got promoted. Then he allied with Black Lives Matter, and his life went off the rails.

item.title: What’s Next in Health Care for Older Adults: Questions and Answers With John Whyte, MD
item.description: As WebMD’s chief medical officer, John Whyte, MD, is in a unique position to see both the current state of medical care for America’s older adults and the way things are trending for the future. We asked him to share his insight on a few topics, along with a bit of advice.

item.title: Home Prices Hit Another Record: Are Americans Still Right About Real Estate?
item.description: Home prices are still soaring as they hit a new record high, despite high mortgage rates and low inventory dampening demand. At some point, this unaffordable housing market must make […]

item.title: You’ve spoken! Meet the Disrupt 2024 breakout session audience choice winners
item.description: TechCrunch Disrupt showcases cutting-edge technology and innovation, and this year’s edition will not disappoint. Among thousands of insightful breakout session submissions for this year’s Audience Choice program, five breakout sessions have soared to the top and were selected by thousands of people from around the globe to speak at this year’s event. item.title: The Marshall Project Wins Prestigious Robert F. Kennedy Journalism Award for Criminal Justice
item.description: The award recognizes our 2023 investigation exposing lax prison discipline for abusive guards in New York state prisons.

item.title: Get the Care You Need in a COVID-19 World
item.description: What to expect at the doctor’s office, hospitals, and long-term care facilities, the future of telemedicine, and how to get the best care during COVID-19.

item.title: How to Use the BRRRR Method to “Invest on Repeat”

item.title: Zero-day flaw in Check Point VPNs is ‘extremely easy’ to exploit
item.description: Check Point is the latest security vendor to fix a vulnerability in its technology, which it sells to companies to protect their networks. © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Police Tactics at Some Pro-Palestine Protests Ignore Past Lessons
item.description: While some universities have sought peaceful approaches, others have used aggressive policing that bucks research from the protests following George Floyd’s murder.

item.title: Personal Shopper: A Savvy Black Entrepreneur Guides You to Eczema-Friendly Clothes, Creams, Cosmetics, and More
item.description: A savvy black entrepreneur guides you on an eczema-friendly shopping spree.

item.title: Watch Out for These 1031 Exchange Nuances That Could Ground Your Deal to a Halt

item.title: Spotify offers Car Thing refunds as it faces lawsuit over bricking the streaming device
item.description: Though Spotify never shared official numbers, it's likely that Car Thing underperformed or was just not worth continued investment in today's tighter economic market. © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Susan Chira to Step Down as The Marshall Project’s Editor-in-Chief in January
item.description: Under her stewardship, the news nonprofit more than doubled in size, opened local newsrooms and won its second Pulitzer Prize.

item.title: Behind the Spike in Colorectal Cancer Among Young Americans
item.description: Colorectal cancer cases increased a whopping 333% among 15- to 19-year-olds and 185% among 20- to 24-year-olds from 1999 to 2020.
